meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins preexist the modern city.
meanings.sent2: The documents preexist the new regulations.
meanings.sent3: The idea that cats rule the world preexists in many cartoons.
meanings.sent4: The memory of her laughter preexists in my mind like a melody.
meanings.sent5: The scent of pine preexists in the forest, welcoming visitors.

meanings.definition: To be present or in existence before something else
meanings.sent1: The old traditions preexist in this community.
meanings.sent2: The foundation of the house preexists the walls.
meanings.sent3: The rumor that aliens live among us preexists in science fiction stories.
meanings.sent4: The feeling of anticipation preexists the arrival of the guests.
meanings.sent5: The sense of calm preexists in the early morning hours.
